de.mdelab.morisia.comparch.simulator

Interface ComparchSimulator


  • public interface ComparchSimulator
    Interface to use the simulator. If the simulator has been obtained from the factory with the Capability.BLANK, then it must be configured by adding Injectors (see addInjector(Injector)) and Analyzers (see addAnalyzer(Analyzer)). If the simulator has the capabilities Capability.SELF_REPAIR, Capability.SELF_OPTIMIZATION, or Capability.SELF_MANAGEMENT, then the corresponding injectors and analyzers have been automatically added. Finally, an InjectionStrategy can be set to the simulator to specify a scenario for the simulation. See method setInjectionStrategy(InjectionStrategy). If no strategy is set, then the simulator uses its default strategy (random injection of issues). Then, the simulator can be used by invoking validate() to analyze the model and injectIssues() to inject issues into the model. These methods respectively invoke Injectors according to the InjectionStrategy as well as the Analyzers. Finally, isSimulationCompleted() is used to check whether the simulation has been completed or not.
    Version:
    0.30
    Author:
    thomas vogel

    • Method Detail

      • setInjectionStrategy

        void setInjectionStrategy(InjectionStrategy strategy)
        Sets the injection strategy that replaces the default strategy of the simulator.
        Parameters:
        strategy - the injection strategy

      • getInjectors

        java.util.List<Injector<? extends de.mdelab.morisia.comparch.ArchitecturalElement>> getInjectors()
        Returns:
        a unmodifiable list of the injectors used by the simulator.

      • getSupportedIssueTypes

        IssueType[] getSupportedIssueTypes()
        Returns:
        a list of IssueTypes that are supported by the simulator according to its configuration and capability.

      • isSimulationCompleted

        boolean isSimulationCompleted()
        Returns true if the simulation has been completed, else false.
        Returns:
        true if the simulation has been completed, else false.

      • addInjector

        void addInjector(Injector<? extends de.mdelab.morisia.comparch.ArchitecturalElement> injector)
        Adds the given injector to the simulator.
        Parameters:
        injector - the injector to be added.

      • addAnalyzer

        void addAnalyzer(Analyzer analyzer)
        Adds the given analyzer to the simulator.
        Parameters:
        analyzer - the analyzer to be added.

      • validate

        int validate()
        Validates the model using the analyzers.
        Returns:
        the number of failures identified by the validation.

      • injectIssues

        void injectIssues()
        Injects issues into the model using the injectors according to the InjectionStrategy. The issues injected by one invocation of this method should be handled by one run of the feedback loop. Hence, one invocation of this method corresponds to one run of the simulator.
